page.title: 02Motor Racing at Brands Hatch
page.content:
{Brands Hatch}Motor Racing Circuit is one of the country's two cicuits licenced for international{Grand Prix} events.
Set around a natural small valley in the North Downs the shorter,{Indy course, some 1.2 miles, is visible in its entirity from any vantage point around the track. The longer,{Grand {Prix}course is 2.6 miles around and makes a lengthy loop through woodland adjoining the short circuit.
The circuit is scheduled to hold racing on 85 days in 1985, 33 of which are for motor-cycles. Every other day throughout the year the circuit is in use for general testing, driving instruction and private functions (such as new car launches).
